metadata.title: CVE-2023-36864 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An integer overflow vulnerability exists in the fstReaderIterBlocks2temp_signal_value_buf allocation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. Aspecially crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victimwould need to open a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
